intro: Vandenboschia johnstonensis, commonly known as the Johnston's vandenboschia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it is well-suited for xeriscaping and requires minimal water once established.
